entry.def: Containment is the action or policy of keeping another country's power or area of control within acceptable limits or boundaries.
The containment of something dangerous or unpleasant is the act or process of keeping it under control within a particular area or place.

example.ex: Fire crews are hoping they can achieve full containment of the fire before the winds pick up.
example.tran: 消防队员希望趁着风还没有起来将火势完全控制住。

means.word_mean: 1. a policy of creating strategic alliances in order to check the expansion of a hostile power or ideology or to force it to negotiate pecefully;

sentences.sentence: "containment of communist expansion was a central principle of United States' foreign policy from 1947 to the 1975"

means.word_mean: 2. (physics) a system designed to prevent the accidental release of radioactive material from a reactor
3. (military) the act of containing something or someone; keeping it from spreading;

sentences.sentence: "the army was charged with the containment of the rebel forces"
